intro: Myrceugenia exsucca var. quetrihuensis, commonly known as the Quetrihué myrtle, is a shrub native to the temperate rainforests of southern Chile. It is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisine. It thrives in moist, cool climates and is often found in montane forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
